content:
An ampule bottle measuring 10 × 8 mm (o.d. × i.d.) was charged with TAPA (13 mg, 0.026 mmol), TBAP (22.8 mg, 0.031 mmol), 1.0 mL of 1,2-dichlorobenzene, and 0.2 mL of 6 M aqueous acetic acid solution. The bottle was flash frozen at 77 K (liquid N2 bath), evacuated to an internal pressure of below 8 Pa and flame-sealed. The reaction was heated at 140 °C for 5 days, yielding a yellow solid, which was isolated by filtration and washed with anhydrous N,N-dimethylacetamide and anhydrous tetrahydrofuran (THF), the resulting powder was immersed in anhydrous THF for 24 h and dried at room temperature and under vacuum at 100 °C overnight.

Synthesis of 3D Cu@COF-TATB

The mixture of 3D COF-TATB (1 mg) and CuCl2•2H2O (1.34 mg) were ground by the agate mortar and pulverized by sonic probe for 2 h (1500 W) to obtain the nanoscale 3D COF-TATB. Then the mixed solution was stirred for 24 h and sonicated for 6 h (360 W) to fully complex Cu2+. The obtained 3D Cu@COF-TATB were collected via centrifugation and washed with water for three times to remove the unreacted CuCl2 (12 000 rpm, 10 min).
clean_text:
Experimental Section

Synthesis of 3D COF-TATB

An ampule bottle measuring 10 × 8 mm (o.d. × i.d.) was charged with TAPA (13 mg, 0.026 mmol), TBAP (22.8 mg, 0.031 mmol), 1.0 mL of 1,2-dichlorobenzene, and 0.2 mL of 6 M aqueous acetic acid solution. The bottle was flash frozen at 77 K (liquid N2 bath), evacuated to an internal pressure of below 8 Pa and flame-sealed. The reaction was heated at 140 °C for 5 days, yielding a yellow solid, which was isolated by filtration and washed with anhydrous N,N-dimethylacetamide and anhydrous tetrahydrofuran (THF), the resulting powder was immersed in anhydrous THF for 24 h and dried at room temperature and under vacuum at 100 °C overnight.

Synthesis of 3D Cu@COF-TATB

The mixture of 3D COF-TATB (1 mg) and CuCl2⋅2H2O (1.34 mg) were ground by the agate mortar and pulverized by sonic probe for 2 h (1500 W) to obtain the nanoscale 3D COF-TATB. Then the mixed solution was stirred for 24 h and sonicated for 6 h (360 W) to fully complex Cu2+. The obtained 3D Cu@COF-TATB were collected via centrifugation and washed with water for three times to remove the unreacted CuCl2 (12000 rpm, 10 min).
